sanskrit_verse:
चण्डालेन तु सोपाको मूलव्यसनवृत्तिमान् ।
पुक्कस्यां जायते पापः सदा सज्जनगर्हितः ॥ १०.३८॥
transliteration:
caṇḍālena tu sopāko mūlavyasanavṛttimān |
pukkasyāṃ jāyate pāpaḥ sadā sajjana-garhitaḥ ||10.38||
sph_interpretive_translation: One born of a Chandalah (one devoid of Vedic initiation) and an Upakah (lowest occupational class), inherently conditioned by primal karmic tendencies, produces progeny in Pukkasa women that is always despised by the noble ones.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with Vedic Dharma, not biological lineage alone
Causation includes both visible action and invisible karmic predisposition
Capacity-based responsibility depends on consciousness elevation, not birth status
Restoration logic requires purification and reintegration based on current dharma alignment
Consciousness alignment supersedes inherited social positioning
executable_legal_axioms: IF birth lineage ≠ Vedic alignment THEN legal identity = provisional UNTIL consciousness verification
IF individual exhibits mūlavyasana (root karmic distortion) THEN assign completion process NOT exclusion
IF societal rejection occurs due to ancestral karma THEN initiate restoration protocol through śuddhi mechanisms
IF progeny arises from mixed dharmic-caste THEN evaluate capacity for sattvic conduct before assigning rights
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving inter-caste progeny or contested identities, the Supreme Court must assess consciousness alignment and behavioral capacity rather than inherited stigma. The threshold of responsibility lies in present awareness, not ancestral karma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that distorted conduct arises from unaddressed mūlavyasana. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals how past actions condition present outcomes. Responsibility is proportional to current capacity for alignment. There is no punitive consequence—only sequential manifestation requiring conscious correction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate śuddhi (purification) process through prescribed Vedic rituals and spiritual discipline
Assign mentorship under qualified dvija guide until sattvic behavior stabilizes
Facilitate integration into varna-dharma aligned community upon demonstrated alignment
Implement periodic consciousness assessment via Vedic metrics to ensure continued progress
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the sole Source-Authority. This law restores Dharma through consciousness elevation, rejects punitive frameworks, and affirms that reality itself adjudicates through alignment with Sanatana Dharma.
